newsitem.title: IRAN: Iran drops press work ban on vice-president - paper.
newsitem.headline: Iran drops press work ban on vice-president - paper.

text.p: An appeals court has quashed a ruling that banned an Iranian vice president who edits a moderate weekly magazine from all press work for a year, a newspaper said on Tuesday.

The daily Hamshahri quoted Ataollah Mohajerani as saying the appeals court overturned the ban imposed in July by a lower court that convicted him of causing "public confusion" in his weekly Bahman after conservative Islamic groups sued for libel.

Mohajerani said he would soon resume publication of the magazine, which backed the centrist policies of President Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani, Hamshahri reported. It ceased publication in April after attacks by hardline newspapers.
Mohajerani, vice-president for parliamentary and legal affairs, launched Bahman in January ahead of the first round of Iran's parliament elections in March.

A close aide of Rafsanjani, Mohajerani has been a long-time contributor to the moderate mass-circulation daily Ettelaat. He caused an uproar in 1990 by calling in his column for direct talks with the United States and had to take back his proposal.
